data.Name: Generic
data.Description: This subject area includes all the data categories which are transverse to the whole specialized data domains. This holds all the entities which have a lifecycle independent of any business domain – as being related to the platform operations, to the "supports" of the business (finance, human resources, etc.) or as being inherited from the routine (countries, unit of measure, etc.)

data.Name: Subsurface
data.Description: Data about or related to something located or introduced beneath the surface of the earth.

data.Name: Well
data.Description: A proposed, permitted or actual drilled hole in the ground designed to exchange (or facilitate the exchange of) fluids between a subsurface reservoir and the surface (or another reservoir), or to enable the detection and measurement of rock properties.

data.Name: Surface Facilities
data.Description:
A facility is defined as being a piece of equipment, a collection of pieces of equipment, or a role that a piece of equipment plays. 
Facilities are required to handle any kind of energy sources, to transform, store, transfer them.
These facilities can be everything from gas processing plants and batteries to pumps, metering station, and pipelines.

The facility is an assembly of equipment, assembled to perform a physical or chemical process.
A facility represents the high-level function to be performed and is decomposed in process units.

data.Name: Production
data.Description: This domain applies to all forms of material, fluid or energy production or generation, such as those from conventional hydrocarbons, material mining, mineral production, or renewable sources. It also includes fluid injection or disposal (such as water injection or disposal, or carbon dioxide injection as part of CCUS activities). Production encompasses details about the entities involved, output quantities, the method of production and distribution, and information on the extraction, injection or generation process.

data.Name: Mining
data.Description: This domain encompasses all data related to the extraction, processing, and production of solid mineral resources from the earth, covering the complete lifecycle from exploration through closure.

data.Name: Legal Agreement
data.Description: Covers current and historical information about authorization or consents to undertake operations or business activities. . This can be referred as License, Contract, Lease, Concession and allows to track detailed information about the contents of applications, documents or other material submitted as supporting materials and relationships to any licenses or consents received as a result

data.Name: Data Quality
data.Description: Covers all management aspects of the degree of usability of the enterprise’s data, including analysis and metrics, accuracy, assurance, governance, completeness and corrective/sustaining actions.

data.Name: Entitlements
data.Description: Covers the issues relating to data access and security – which enables users to control of access to data, and what can be done with it.

data.Name: Environment
data.Description: Covers the surroundings in which an entity operates, including air, water, land, natural resources, flora, fauna, humans and their interrelation.

data.Name: Location
data.Description: Describes the geodetic data (coordinates, datum, projection system) and the definition and data structures for geographically and/or political bounded areas.

data.Name: Organisation
data.Description: It is a company, person, consortium or regulatory body such as a jurisdiction, agency or government department.

data.Name: Process Safety
data.Description: A disciplined framework for managing the integrity of operating systems and processes handling hazardous substances by applying good design principles, engineering, and operating practices. (AiCHE)

data.Name: Project/Activity/Study Lifecycle
data.Description: Represents generic activities, projects, studies including involvements with data, physical facilities, business associates, etc.

data.Name: Catalogs
data.Description: Universal reference data that is not specific to a particular domain.

data.Name: Geology / Petrophysics
data.Description: The physical history of the earth and its life as recorded in the rocks, including petrophysical measurements.

data.Name: Geophysics
data.Description: The physics of the Earth, especially its electrical, gravitational and magnetic fields and propagation of elastic (seismic) waves within it.

data.Name: Reservoir
data.Description: A network of porous and permeable subsurface rock bodies that store and transmit fluids within a natural pressure system.

data.Name: Well
data.Description: A proposed, permitted or actual drilled hole in the ground designed to exchange (or facilitate the exchange of) fluids between a subsurface reservoir and the surface (or another reservoir), or to enable the detection and measurement of rock properties. A well consists of one or more wellbores, extending from the bottom of each wellbore up to the top of the Xmas tree on the wellhead.

data.Name: Wellbore
data.Description: A unique well path beginning from the top of the outermost casing string and extending to the total drilled depth of an individual hole. A wellbore may have another wellbore as a parent; in this case, the child wellbore includes a common section from the wellhead down to where it exits the parent wellbore and continues to the total depth of the hole.

data.Name: Completion
data.Description: Completion is a overloaded term that means many different things depending on context.  It has to do with all the things that have to be done between a borehole being finished drilling to TD, to the well being put on production. We have avoided using the term "Completion" in OSDU, preferring "Perforation Interval", "Isolated Interval", "Wellbore Opening" as less ambiguous terms.

data.Name: Well Plan
data.Description: The description of a proposed wellbore including shape, orientation, depth, tubulars, downhole equipment, and evaluation; and the detailed procedure for execution of well construction operations.

data.Name: Well Activity
data.Description: An operation performed on a well to accomplish a predetermined objective. This may be as short as a few hours in duration, or may last several days, weeks or even months. It will have one or more associated daily Operations Reports, and may have other associated data as well.

data.Name: Materials
data.Description: Consumable supplies that are physically used up or permanently altered during well construction or operations activities.

data.Name: Well Equipment
data.Description: Manufactured, non consumable and uniquely identifiable objects permanently installed in a well.

data.Name: Process Facility
data.Description: The collection of commonly owned or operated equipment at any life cycle stage that is located within a specific geographic boundary or surface site for the purpose of production, processing, transmission, storage, or distribution of products prior to the point of custody transfer.

data.Name: Process Equipment
data.Description: Manufactured, non consumable and uniquely identifiable objects that are of importance to the enterprise to track at the individual instance level. This represents the technical or 'physical' part of the Plant Maintenance Asset structure as opposed to Functional Locations. Instrument is a subtype of equipment, used directly or indirectly to measure and/or control a variable.

data.Name: Facility & Equipment Operations & Maintenance
data.Description: Covers the equipment maintenance and inspection strategies based on risk, availability requirements, reliability information, degradation mechanisms and failure modes, resulting in planned/preventive maintenance and inspection details, programs and schedules.

data.Name: Production Accounting
data.Description: Production accounting involves the allocated reporting of all forms of material or energy production or generation, such as volumetric, mass, and energy data.

data.Name: Production Optimization
data.Description: Production optimization focuses on arranging of all forms of material or energy production in a manner that balances efficiency, cost & profits through proper planning and scheduling and operations.

data.Name: Production Forecast
data.Description: It is an estimate of expected material or energy production based on past production history. The objective of this process is to build, assess, and communicate a technically defensible projection of future production
